s.text: What we get instead is a trip in the sand: Jooky in hand, a volleyball player falls flat on his face.
What we get instead is a trip in the sand: Jooky in hand, a volleyball player falls flat on his face.
Initial impressions notwithstanding, Jooky ends up making intention and product crystal clear: It's taking on a whole genre on behalf of a drink that promises only good taste, not the good life.
But of course, it's everything in a spot that turns sunny visuals against soft-drink advertisers, using the images to make the long-overdue point that they are a stupid reason to pick a drink.
The anti-image as image is powerful indeed.
What we get instead is a trip in the sand: Jooky in hand, a volleyball player falls flat on his face.
This pair falls plumb in the middle of the Jooky target group: no dates, no sun, no sand.
